DataElement.preferredName: Current Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Indication Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the reason for the current hematopoietic cell transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_The replacement of tissue with tissue from the person's own body or from another person._A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
